H0.text: Hail are groups of tiny droplets of water seen floating in the air that can give scientists a clue about the weather.

H1.text: Rain are groups of tiny droplets of water floating in the air that can give scientists a clue about the weather.

H2.text: A front is a group of tiny droplets of water floating in the air that can give scientists a clue about the weather.

H3.text: A cloud is a group of tiny droplets of water floating in the air that can give scientists a clue about the weather.

A4.text: In meteorology, a cloud is an aerosol consisting of a visible mass of miniature liquid droplets, ice crystals, or other particles, suspended in the atmosphere of a planetary body or similar space.

A5.text: Water or various other chemicals may comprise the droplets and crystals.
